intro: Alloispermum palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces a milky sap that is typical of the family, and its flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. Alloispermum palmeri is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
